messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:13): what will <b>x<i>y</b>z</i> parse into? is it <b>x</b><i><b>y</b>z</i> or <b>x<i>y</i></b><i>z</i>?
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:29): there is no definite answer to that, it will vary between browsers afaik
437cfbff8f388472adbdea4c9f8efaf0 (11:30): 3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97: I assume the question is related to what it will parse as following HTML5
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:30): handling of incorrect nesting is also defined?
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:31): I _really_ need to get through that spec some day :-$
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:31): ouch, <!-- and --> parsing in <style> blocks
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:33): Every time I say something in here I seem to lodge my foot in my mouth :p
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): that can be solved by reading the spec multiple times in multiple directions
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:39): I'll take a note of that :)
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:42): heh. Opera print preview didn't like the specs... :p
437cfbff8f388472adbdea4c9f8efaf0 (11:43): printing is black magic
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:45): It just took a while :)
437cfbff8f388472adbdea4c9f8efaf0 (11:45): it's a large file
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:46): 3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97: http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/printing-wa10/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:52): It's funny. You ask for comments on the document itself and people start complaining about HTML5 terminology such as XHTML5
3b579c2ab63202106c8b4b13e0ccfc97 (11:55): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: Thanks for the tip. :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:57): Ah, the <script><!-- <script> --> </script> makes more sense now
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: you mean <script><!-- </script> --> </script> ?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:59): yeah
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:07): I wasn't aware it had to do with <!-- and -->
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:09): thinks it's kind of neat
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:10): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: your latest email to public-html probably had a copy-paste error
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:11): should it say ...(obviously) also not in XHTML5.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:13): hmm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:13): the attributes of elements, that are in HTML4 but not in HTML5, are not in HTML5
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:13): is what I'm trying to say although I wonder how useful it is given the amount of confusion
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:14): isn't it an obvious tautology that stuff that isn't in foo isn't in foo?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:14): would suggest to drop the paragraph
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:14): ok, dropped it
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (12:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, hendry: <http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/3791983.stm> describes millions of people who use Java embedded in Web pages
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:24): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e - What do you think of DanC's proposed introduction for the HTML5vs4 diff doc?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:25): I'm working on that right now
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:26): The last paragraph needs some work I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:26): HTML became an application of SGML starting with HTML2
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:26): and I don't think any implementation ever had a fully conforming SGML parser
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:29): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: yeah, games are a case that I'd count as not benefiting from HTML embedding (i.e. better as WebStart)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:30): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: I'm not trying to say that applet don't exist. I was just giving hendry my opinion that applets tend to always be a worse solution than WebStart or JavaScript
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:34): hmm, I see Hixie recently changed part of the intro of the parsing section to read:

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:34): The resulting confusion ‚Äî with validators claiming documents to have one representation while widely deployed Web browsers interoperably implemented a different representation ‚Äî has wasted decades of productivity.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:35): just added the "wasted decades of productivity" part
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (12:36): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I haven't used Web Start, but from screenshots I'm not sure that the target audience would understand it well
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:37): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, I don't see that here...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:38): I see that now though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:41): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: WebStart does suffer from the same usability vs. security problem as MIDP
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:42): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: that is, the defaults are too secure and users are asked to authorize stuff they don't understand
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (12:42): MIDP?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:42): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: Java on phones
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:42): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: the thing you use to run Opera Mini
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (12:43): Actually, I don't :-)
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (12:43): but thanks for the explanation
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:43): Opera Mini is the only useful use case I have so far
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:43): although I hear that Google Maps Mini is good, too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): (My phone is too old for Google Maps Mini)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: anyway, every time I start using Opera Mini, I have to clear an authorization menu, which sucks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - Opera Mini the only useful use case for MIDP?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:47): judging from Wii and Maemo, having Flash support in a browser is a much higher priority than having Java applet support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: so far for me, yes
